Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
Allied, Axis
public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Player class represents a player in the game. Player can be Axis or Allied.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Asma

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Player​(java.lang.String name, int numberOfCards)
    Creates a new player with specific number of cards in which the player can have in every round.

    • Player

      public Player​(java.lang.String name, int numberOfCards)
      Creates a new player with specific number of cards in which the player can have in every round.
      Parameters:
      numberOfCards - number of cards in which the player can have in every round
      name - player's name

    • cardsListSize

      protected boolean cardsListSize()
      Check if the cards list is full or not.
      Returns:
      true if there is empty place to add a new card.

    • checkCardExistenceInTheList

      protected boolean checkCardExistenceInTheList​(Card card)
      Check if the entered card exists in the player's card list.
      Parameters:
      card - card to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the card exists in the list

    • removeCardFromListByIndex

      protected void removeCardFromListByIndex​(int index)
      Remove a card from cards list by it's index.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the card

    • addPlayerInitialForces

      protected abstract void addPlayerInitialForces()
      Player has a set of forces. Add these forces for the player.

    • addToScores

      protected void addToScores()
      Add a score to player's scores.

    • subtractFromScores

      protected void subtractFromScores()
      Subtract a score from player's scores.

    • checkForBeingInSpacialLocation

      protected boolean checkForBeingInSpacialLocation()
      Check if any of player's forces are in the special location. If yes add to player's scores and return true.
      Returns:
      true if any of player's forces are in the special location

    • returnPlayerType

      protected abstract java.lang.String returnPlayerType()
      Return the type of player (Axis or Allied) as a string.
      Returns:
      a string for player type

    • returnCardNumberOfUnits

      protected int returnCardNumberOfUnits​(int index)
      Return the number of units for the card which is located in the entered index.
      Parameters:
      index - index of player cards list
      Returns:
      number of units for the card which is located in the entered index

    • returnCardDifferentForceType

      protected boolean returnCardDifferentForceType​(int index)
      Return the different force type for the card which is located in the entered index.
      Parameters:
      index - index of player cards list
      Returns:
      different force type for the card which is located in the entered index

    • checkForNumbersOfSelectedForces

      protected boolean checkForNumbersOfSelectedForces​(boolean differentUnits, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> numbersOfSelectedForces)
      Check if the numbers of forces that has been selected by the player are valid or not. Numbers must be in the range of forces list. If the selected card by player is for ordering identical units and the player has been selected non-identical units return false.
      Parameters:
      differentUnits - differentUnits for the selected card by the player
      numbersOfSelectedForces - numbers of forces that have been selected by the user
      Returns:
      true if numbers of forces are valid

    • returnPlayerForceIndexBasedOnLocation

      protected int returnPlayerForceIndexBasedOnLocation​(int row, int column)
      Return the player's force number based of location of the force.
      Parameters:
      row - row of the location of the force
      column - column of the location of the force
      Returns:
      index + 1 for matched force with the location

    • showCards

      protected void showCards()
      This method shows the player's cards.

    • listLocationOfPlayerForces

      protected int listLocationOfPlayerForces()
      List player's forces. List type, group size, and location of the forces.
      Returns:
      number of forces (in group) that the player has.

    • printName

      protected void printName()
      Print player type and name.
